net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.color

Class GenericColor

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.AbstractDatatype
      • net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.color.GenericColor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Datatype

    public final class GenericColor
extends AbstractDatatype
    This is the Datatype for a Color based on factors.
    Note:
    Use Color for simple and efficient representation and transport of color information. However, if precision is required or for transformation between different color models use this class instead.
    Credits:
    The algorithms for transformation of the color models are mainly taken from HSL and HSV on wikipedia.
    ATTENTION:
    This implementation does not support color profiles or the Adobe RGB color space.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • calculateRgb

        private static void calculateRgb(GenericColor genericColor,
                                 Hue hue,
                                 double min,
                                 double chroma)
        Calculates and the RGB values and sets them in the given GenericColor.
        Parameters:
        genericColor - is the GenericColor to complete.
        hue - is the Hue value.
        min - is the minimum Factor of R/G/B.
        chroma - is the Chroma value.

      • invert

        public GenericColor invert(ColorModel model)
        Parameters:
        model - the ColorModel indicating the Segments to invert. Typically ColorModel.RGB to build the complement of the color.
        Returns:
        the complementary (or inverse) color.

      • lighten

        public GenericColor lighten(ColorFactor factor)
        Lightens this color by the given factor.
        Parameters:
        factor - is the factor to increase by. E.g. 0.0 will cause no change, while 1.0 will return white.
        Returns:
        a new color lighter by the given factor.

      • darken

        public GenericColor darken(ColorFactor factor)
        Darkens this color by the given factor.
        Parameters:
        factor - is the factor to decrease by. E.g. 0.0 will cause no change, while 1.0 will return black.
        Returns:
        a new color darker by the given factor.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Description copied from interface: Datatype
        Returns the official String representation of this Datatype. While the general contract of Object.toString() is very weak and mainly used for debugging, the contract here is very strong. The returned String has to be suitable for end-users and official output to any kind of sink.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is not supposed to do internationalization (I18N). See NlsMessage for this purpose and implement NlsObject if you want to support I18N/L10N.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Datatype
        Specified by:
        toString in class AbstractDatatype
        Returns:
        the official String representation to display the value of this Datatype.

      • toString

        public String toString(ColorModel colorModel)
        Parameters:
        colorModel - is the ColorModel.
        Returns:
        this color as String in notation of the given ColorModel (e.g. "rgba(255, 128, 64, 1.0)" for ColorModel.RGB).
